classes.class_description: Steels (such as carbon steel, 0.5Mo steel, and low alloy C-Mo steel) that are prone to graphitization, a microstructural change causing loss of strength and ductility.

members.entity_description: A type of steel that undergoes graphitization at elevated temperatures.

members.entity_description: A type of steel susceptible to graphitization, especially with up to 1% Mo.
members.resolution_context: Graphitization has been found in low alloy C-Mo steels with up to 1% Mo.

members.entity_description: Steels with up to 9% chromium and other alloys for high temperature strength and creep resistance.

Can_2acbb9eb.entity_description: A type of metallurgical structure (austenite) found in 300 Series stainless steels and nickel base alloys, known for its corrosion resistance.
Can_2acbb9eb.resolution_context: Both entities refer to the same metallurgical structure, austenite, found in stainless steels and nickel base alloys, with overlapping descriptions and contexts.

Can_449bd7c2.entity_description: A type of metallurgical structure (ferrite) found in carbon and low alloy steels and many 400 series stainless steels, known for its corrosion resistance.
Can_449bd7c2.resolution_context: Both entities refer to the same metallurgical structure known as ferritic, found in certain types of steels, and the descriptions complement each other.

Can_c3c96b1a.entity_description: A metallurgical structure (martensite) found in some stainless steels, known for its corrosion resistance.
Can_c3c96b1a.resolution_context: Both entities describe 'martensitic' as a metallurgical structure found in stainless steels, with similar descriptions and contexts, indicating they refer to the same concept.

En_d9cbe1b8.resolution_context: Austenitic stainless steels are the 300 Series stainless steels including Types 304, 304L, 304H, 309, 310, 316, 316L, 316H, 321, 321H, 347, and 347H.

En_e3269efb.entity_description: A type of stainless steel that includes Types 410, 410S, 416, 420, 440A, 440B, and 440C.
En_e3269efb.resolution_context: Martensitic stainless steel includes Types 410, 410S, 416, 420, 440A, 440B, and 440C, indicating a specific family of stainless steels with martensitic structure.

Can_3476493c.entity_description: Result of carbide phase decomposition in steels at elevated temperatures, forming graphite nodules.
Can_3476493c.resolution_context: Both entities describe the transformation of carbide phases into graphite nodules, indicating they refer to the same concept.

Can_04c94b79.entity_description: A type of cracking in steel caused by the presence of hydrogen and stress, often near welds, characterized by cracks aligned nearly perpendicular to stress.
Can_04c94b79.resolution_context: Both entities describe the same damage mechanism, SOHIC, which involves stress-oriented cracking in hydrogen-exposed steel, often near welds.

En_d0d2d7c7.entity_description: Stepwise internal cracks in metal connecting hydrogen blisters, occurring without external stress.
En_d0d2d7c7.resolution_context: Hydrogen Induced Cracking (HIC) is characterized by internal cracks that connect hydrogen blisters in metal, forming without external stress and linking through a transgranular plastic shear mechanism.

En_95198f7a.entity_description: Fitness-For-Service standard for assessing the integrity of equipment.

En_c25b73ff.resolution_context: MPC Report FS-26 outlines fitness-for-service evaluation procedures for operating pressure vessels, tanks, and piping in refinery and chemical service.

En_d2a9115d.entity_description: Change in microstructure of carbon and 0.5Mo steels causing loss of strength and ductility.
En_d2a9115d.resolution_context: Graphitization is a change in the microstructure of certain carbon steels and 0.5Mo steels after long-term operation in the 800oF to 1100oF range that may cause a loss in strength, ductility, and/or creep resistance.

En_f6aa95ca.entity_description: An alloying element in stainless steels that provides resistance to oxidation and corrosion.
En_f6aa95ca.resolution_context: Chromium is mentioned as an alloying element in stainless steels, contributing to their resistance to oxidation and corrosion.

En_417e7d84.entity_description: Element added to steel to eliminate graphitization.
En_417e7d84.resolution_context: The addition of about 0.7% chromium has been found to eliminate graphitization.

En_56c0bd49.entity_description: A chemical reaction that stainless steels resist due to their alloy content.
En_56c0bd49.resolution_context: Stainless steels are described as having resistance to oxidation, a form of corrosion, due to their alloy content.

En_fefc46ef.entity_description: A chemical reaction that stainless steels resist due to their alloy content.
En_fefc46ef.resolution_context: Stainless steels are described as having resistance to sulfidation, a form of corrosion, due to their alloy content.
